intro: Duguetia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Duguetia colombiana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth.
